Key Match Events: Chris Bassitt struck out nine batters, matching a season-high, and pitched 6 2/3 innings with one run allowed
Pre-Game Insights: Chris Bassitt credited his success to switching his spot up on the mound from the first base side to the third base side
Post-Match Reflections: Manager John Schneider praised Bassitt's performance, saying he settled in after the first inning and had a really good mix of pitches
Red Sox manager Alex Cora praised Bassitt's pitching, saying he put on a clinic
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Blue Jays' bats were stymied by Brayan Bello, who threw a career-high eight innings with two hits and one walk
Boston added two more runs in the bottom of the eighth to keep the Blue Jays at arm's length
Others: The game was a pitchers' duel between Chris Bassitt and Brayan Bello
Bassitt said that Bello had his number, and that he did a good job living down and on the edges
